info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 1:08PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHATHAM COUNTY... At 107 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Hunter Army Airfield. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Pooler, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, Savannah International Airport and Montgomery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
